reviews.review_msg: I have approached Dr. Lucas many times, especially regarding quetions for my final essay and presentation and she has been really awsome and clear with the way she answered all my questions. Sorry if that doesn't really match with what people are saying but I think she is an amazing prof and people are unjustly upset.

I would not recommend this class or this professor. She has very limited yet liberal view points and absolutely will take marks off if you disagree with her opinions. She makes outrageous claims concerning misogyny and this class reads a lot like propaganda.
Would not take again.
Best part of this class was not going.

She never actually teaches. Class was entirely student led discussion and all she did was add her weird bias input onto everything. She says that eating human meat is moral, and will fight with you on it. She brings up inappropriate topics of conversation with little regard for people's comfort. And thinks practically everything is sexist.

The class was essentially 2-3 people presenting on a section of that week's textbook chapter, and then class discussions. Attendance required at least 5 times to get participation marks and hand in response papers. An enjoyable class but would have liked to learn more from the prof and less from other students.

Flipped classroom
Pros: class/prof is not intense + no exams makes the course less stressful
Cons: Need to hand in reading responses in person, but not if u miss more than 15 minutes of class time. Missed a bus? Life happened? Might as well shred ur work. Grading is arbitrary. -3 on a paper over 20 for citing a secondary instead of primary source

One of the most unorganized, confusing, and boring professor ever. His syllabus modifies all the time, as he counts it as "provisional". The readings are horrible, long and boring. There are no structures in his lectures. He's everywhere, and his voice is kind of boring. It's really painful to stay in lecture, but he takes attendance for your 10%.

Gave me a final grade before he read my final paper! Oh and he LOST my final paper, thank god I still had it on my computer. Not very helpful. Had him for 120 and I dont remember him being that uncooperative.

I took PHIL 321 and 326 with Dr. Warriner and I enjoyed both classes. Specifically, it's nice to have a phil prof with real world experiences, and on top of that she was also an excellent teacher and fair marker. I would definitely take a class with her again.

Took bioethics with her and loved it!! Very good at carrying class discussions and is accessible for feedback and help. Slightly confused by her grading as I did really well on some essays and others not so much even though I applied her feedback before submitting them all. Very passionate and knowledgable and I looked forward to class every week!

Very nice person.  For 300 classes she needs to lose the overheads, they seem to mess her up.  She will follow them, then get into something, then look back at them and read them out.  This really loses momentum.     When it comes to the material she knows the detail.  What she needs to focus on is preperation for student questions.
I am not a phil major so this was a bit hard for me BUT Bruno is a great prof. Such a nice guy and always there to help you and his lectures are not boring. 10/10 would recommend
loves talking to students, great to listen to. highly recommended

(ethical issues in art): one of the best professors i've ever had. dr. king is a fantastic lecturer and is super helpful to speak with regarding assignments. she gives great feedback and seems to be a fair marker. she is very understanding and responds to emails quickly. overall, a fantastic professor and a great class, can't recommend enough.

Professor King is great. The assigned readings, while a lot, build on one another very nicely and her lectures complemented them nicely. She is very understanding and her marking is as fair as you can get. Only critique is that some questions in the weekly assignments seemed to be a bit vague but since she marks so fairly, this was a nonissue.
